intro: Cheiranthus albiflorus, commonly known as the white-flowered candytuft, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves and showy clusters of small, white flowers. The flowers are borne on elongated pedicels and bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
